text: John Frederick "Jack" Portland (July 30, 1912 - August 22, 1996) was a defenceman in the NHL from 1933 to 1943. He was born in Collingwood, Ontario. He also participated in the high jump and triple jump events at the 1932 Summer Olympics in Los Angeles.Obituary ==Awards and achievements== *Can-Am First All-Star Team (1936) ==References== ==External links== * * Category:1912 births Category:1996 deaths Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 1932 Summer Olympics Category:Boston Bruins players Category:Buffalo Bisons (AHL) players Category:Canadian ice hockey defencemen Category:Canadian military personnel of World War II Category:Chicago Blackhawks players Category:Montreal Canadiens players Category:Olympic track and field athletes of Canada Category:Philadelphia Rockets players Category:Stanley Cup champions Category:Washington Lions players Category:Track and field athletes from Ontario Category:Ice hockey people from Ontario Category:Sportspeople from Collingwood, Ontario Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 1930 British Empire Games Category:Commonwealth Games competitors for Canada Category:Canadian male high jumpers Category:Canadian male triple jumpers
title: Jack Portland
